hints.content:
We know the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$:

Taylor made $\blueD{8}$ bracelets.

And we know the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$:

She used $\purpleC6$ rubies to make each bracelet.

The product will tell us the $\greenD{\text{total}}$, or how many there are $\greenD{\text{in all}}$.

In this problem, the $\greenD{\text{total}}$ is the $\greenD{\text{number of rubies in all bracelets}}$.
The product tells us the $\greenD{\text{number of rubies in all}}$.

question.content:
Taylor made $8$ ruby bracelets. She used $6$ rubies to make each bracelet.

**What does the expression $8\times6$ represent?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: Number of rubies in each bracelet
